entries.title: AI-changelog web app complete
entries.whats_new: The web application for automatic generation of changelogs using AI has been finished and deployed. It summarizes changes from Git commits and is accessible online.
entries.breaking_change: This release introduces an AI-powered changelog web app that automatically summarizes updates based on Git commits, enabling users to view concise change summaries without manual input. The API and front-end are deployed on Railway and Vercel respectively, and unnecessary code has been cleaned up.
entries.impact: Users can now easily see automatic summaries of updates, making tracking changes more efficient and understandable for non-technical users.

entries.title: Configure user API and open source access
entries.whats_new: Users can now configure their own Git repositories, OpenAI LLM models, API keys, and other settings, allowing for personalized and flexible changelog generation.
entries.breaking_change: This update allows end users to customize their Git repositories and AI models, enhancing the system's flexibility and user control.
entries.impact: Users gain the ability to connect their own codebases and AI models, making the changelog generation tailored to their specific projects.

entries.title: Front-end layout improvements
entries.whats_new: The front-end interface has been decorated, with home page styling, loading effects during changelog display, and a floating navigation bar added.
entries.breaking_change: The interface layout has been improved to enhance user experience, including click behavior to view detailed log entries.
entries.impact: Users will experience a more visually appealing and navigable interface, with easier access to detailed changelog entries.

entries.title: Backend API and cache strategy updates
entries.whats_new: The backend now generates a JSON cache file for the changelog, which the front-end loads for faster access. Layout content has been centered, and icons updated.
entries.breaking_change: The system now adopts a caching mechanism where a JSON file is generated prior to displaying changelogs, and clicking on entries navigates to detailed views.
entries.impact: Changelog loading speed is improved due to caching, providing a smoother viewing experience whereas clicking entries now reveals detailed logs.

entries.title: Installation and deployment enhancements
entries.whats_new: Deployment on Railway has been successful, with updates to requirements files, environment setup, and API deployment configurations.
entries.breaking_change: Deployment process now includes user-configurable environment settings and API keys, supporting custom Git repo and AI configurations.
entries.impact: Developers and users can deploy and customize their systems more easily, enabling tailored changelog generation aligned with their project setup.

entries.title: Interface management and changelog detail page
entries.whats_new: Interfaces have been consolidated into a single file for easy management, and the detailed changelog page now allows navigation to specific entry details.
entries.breaking_change: Clicking on a changelog entry now navigates to a dedicated page with detailed information about that specific update.
entries.impact: Users can now see more detailed information about each changelog entry, improving clarity and traceability of changes.

entries.title: Back-end and front-end cache integration
entries.whats_new: The back-end generates a JSON cache file for the changelog, which the front-end loads to display updates, with layout adjustments and icon updates.
entries.breaking_change: The system now generates and loads a pre-created JSON cache for faster data access and display, with a new layout and icon.
entries.impact: Faster loading times of changelogs and improved user interface for easier navigation and viewing.

entries.title: Basic front-end web layout and features
entries.whats_new: A foundational web interface for viewing changelogs has been implemented, including a sidebar for navigation and content placeholders.
entries.breaking_change: A basic front-end face is now present, with auto-generated content from AI summarizing commits, including detection of breaking changes.
entries.impact: Users can now access a visual representation of project updates, streamlining review of recent changes.

entries.title: Backend API and AI capabilities
entries.whats_new: The backend API was implemented, supporting new features like title, news, breaking change detection, and impact assessments in changelogs, powered by an improved AI model.
entries.breaking_change: The AI generator now automatically identifies potential breaking changes in commits, providing users with alerts about significant modifications.
entries.impact: Users receive more detailed and insightful changelogs, highlighting important or breaking modifications for better awareness.
